dyd_filename.description: This is the dynamics data file used as input to the simulation. This contains the model names, parameters, bus numbers & voltages, etc.

sav_filename.description: This is the save case file used as input to the simulation. This contains the arrangement of the buses, machines, lines, etc., along with initialized values.

chf_filename.description: This is GE proprietary output file of the simulation run, which contains all the outputs of the models' output channels during the length of the simulation.

csv_filename.description: This is output file containing the simulation data, as converted to the csv format.

rep_filename.description: This is the report file generated with the simulation. Should there be any simulation issues, unsteady initial conditions, model instability issues, it would show here.

mes_filename.description: This contains the Site recorded measured data presented in the csv format, used to compare against the simulated data.

StepTimeInSecs.description: At this time in seconds (s), the Vstep is applied to the simulation run.

UpStepInPU.description: At the begin time of the step, this Vstep (pu) is applied to the simulation run.

DnStepInPU.description: At the end time of the step, this Vstep (pu) is removed from the simulation run.

StepLenInSecs.description: This time in seconds (s) is the length of the step, after which the downstep will be applied.

TotTimeInSecs.description: This time in seconds (s) is the total length of the simulation run.

PSS_On.description: If a relevant Power System Stabilizer Model is included in the Dynamics Data File, then unchecking this box disables the PSS model in the simulation run.

SysFreqInHz.description: In general, the system frequency in the US is 60 Hz.

SimPtsPerCycle.description: The simulation delta step is calculated as 1 / (System Frequency * Simulation Points Per Cycle). This number is usually 4 or 8

set_loadflow.description: Checking this box sets the loadflow for this simulation run with the below values. This does not overwrite the save case, just loads initialized values for this simulation run.

save_loadflow.description: Checking this box saves the loadflow for this simulation run, overwriting it in the save case with the below values.

Pinit.description: Initialized value of Real Power of the generator model set into the *.sav loadflow.

Qinit.description: Initialized value of Reactive Power of the generator model set into the *.sav loadflow.

MVAbase.description: MVA base of the generator, as indicated on the nameplate.

Vinit.description: Initialized value of terminal voltage of the generator model set into the *.sav loadflow.

Vbase.description: Terminal Voltage base of the generator, as indicated on the nameplate.

Zbranch.description: The impedance of the system, as seen by the unit, on a 100MVA base. Can use per unitized measured X=dV/dQ to approximate impedance.

UserVar1.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

UserVar2.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

UserVar3.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

UserVar4.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

UserVar5.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

dyd_filename.description: This is the dynamics data file used as input to the simulation. This contains the model names, parameters, bus numbers & voltages, etc.

sav_filename.description: This is the save case file used as input to the simulation. This contains the arrangement of the buses, machines, lines, etc., along with initialized values.

chf_filename.description: This is GE proprietary output file of the simulation run, which contains all the outputs of the models' output channels during the length of the simulation.

rep_filename.description: This is the report file generated with the simulation. Should there be any simulation issues, unsteady initial conditions, model instability issues, it would show here.

in_filename.description: This is the input file for the steady state simulation. There should be 3 or 5 even height columns, with the first 3 being P (MW), Q (MVAR), and Vt (kV). The last 2 columns are optional (but without them you won't get the IF comparison in the output file), and they should be Efe (V) and Ife (A), or Efd (V) and Ifd (A), depending on a brushless or static excitation system, respectively.

out_filename.description: This is the output file for the steady state simulation. The first 10 columns contain the input data and comparisons for the IF measured and simulated, along with percent differences.

Vbase.description: Terminal Voltage base of the generator, as indicated on the nameplate.

Zbranch.description: The impedance of the system, as seen by the unit, on a 100MVA base. Can use per unitized measured X=dV/dQ to approximate impedance.

UserVar1.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.

dyd_filename.description: This is the dynamics data file used as input to the simulation. This contains the model names, parameters, bus numbers & voltages, etc.

sav_filename.description: This is the save case file used as input to the simulation. This contains the arrangement of the buses, machines, lines, etc., along with initialized values.

chf_filename.description: This is GE proprietary output file of the simulation run, which contains all the outputs of the models' output channels during the length of the simulation.

csv_filename.description: This is output file containing the simulation data, as converted to the csv format.

rep_filename.description: This is the report file generated with the simulation. Should there be any simulation issues, unsteady initial conditions, model instability issues, it would show here.

mes_filename.description: This contains the Site recorded measured data presented in the csv format, used to compare against the simulated data.

GenModelName.description: Generator model that is used for the unit. Should match what is in the dyd. This updates the syncmod.p script with the appropriate generator

SyncTimeInSecs.description: The time in the test at which the synchronization occurs.

TotTimeInSec.description: The total simulation time of the test.

PreSyncHz.description: The frequency of the unit just prior to the synchronization.

PostSyncHz.description: The frequency of the unit just after the synchronization.

BaseHz.description: The machine and grid rated speed.

SyncAngleDegs.description: The voltage phase angle between the unit and the grid at the moment of synchronization

PSS_On.description: 0: Disable PSS. 1: Enable PSS. The status of the power system stabilizer during the sync test. 99% of the time this is disabled.

AVR_On.description: 0: Manual Excitation, 1:AVR. The control mode of the voltage regulator during the sync test. 99% of the time this is enabled.

ChangePref.description: 1: Change to MW reference post sync, 0: No change.

OnlinePref.description: ~1.0 for GGOV1, ~0.0 for most other models.

PrefDelay.description: time in seconds after the synchronization when the MW reference is changed.

ChangeVref.description: 1: Change to terminal voltage reference post sync, 0: No change.

OnlineVref.description: The terminal voltage reference of the unit after synchronization.

GenVinit.description: The generator voltage just prior to the synchronization.

Zbranch.description: The impedance of the system, as seen by the unit, on a 100MVA base.

SmibVinit.description: The single machine infinite bus voltage. Adjust this number to set the unit's post sync generator voltage

SmibVbase.description: Single machien infinite bus voltage rating.

UserVar1.description: A user defined string variable. Changing the value of this variable will do nothing, unless you have made changes to the python script specifically associated with this test. Do not make changes to those scripts that you aren't ready to debug yourself and potentially lose on a program update.
